meanings.definition: To make white or lighter in color by exposure to sunlight or by using chemicals.
meanings.sent1: She bleached her hair to make it lighter for the summer.
meanings.sent2: The laundry was bleached in the sun until it was white.
meanings.sent3: The sun bleached the picnic table so much, it looked like a giant marshmallow.
meanings.sent4: His memories of that day were bleached by time, fading into a blur.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush bleached the canvas with strokes of pure white.

meanings.definition: Having been whitened or lightened in color.
meanings.sent1: The bleached shells on the beach sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The bleached bones of the ancient animal were carefully preserved.
meanings.sent3: The bleached sand dunes resembled a vast desert of sugar.
meanings.sent4: Her bleached hair shone like a halo in the dimly lit room.
meanings.sent5: The bleached walls of the old house seemed to glow in the moonlight.
